Join the ACLU’s forum on surveillance and hold law enforcement accountable.


Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Are you concerned about police surveillance practices in Sacramento? Join us on Saturday, January 12 for a forum on surveillance and share your thoughts and experiences with local law enforcement.

The ACLU’s Sacramento chapter is hosting this event to give community members a chance to learn about what type of surveillance police are using and what they are doing with the information they collect. Attendees will have an opportunity to speak to law enforcement directly, voice concerns, and discuss how the community can provide oversight.

This event is wheelchair accessible. Spanish and ASL interpretation are available if requested in advance. Light refreshments and snacks will be provided!

Surveillance in Sacramento

ACLU Forum on Surveillance in Sacramento.

Saturday, January 12, 4-6 p.m.
Fruit Ridge Community Collaborative
4625 44th Street
Sacramento, CA 95820

RSVP TODAY

The event is a chance to join the Sacramento ACLU Chapter and fight for issues that you care about! ACLU chapter members work on a range of issues including criminal justice reform, immigrants’ rights, and gender equity. Chapters are the ACLU's ambassadors in our communities, and keep lawmakers on their toes by representing ACLU priorities and issues. During this event, we will also hold our annual election of chapter board members.

Sign up now to hold Sacramento police accountable!

We look forward to seeing you there,

Dennessa Atiles
Election Chair, ACLU Sacramento Area Chapter
